data: {"generalSituation":"A dry northeast monsoon will affect southern China in the next few days. Tropical Cyclone Fung-wong will move towards the northeastern part of the South China Sea in the next couple of days and turn northwards, moving towards the vicinity of Taiwan. Under the influence of the northeast monsoon, it will weaken gradually. Under the combined effect of Fung-wong and the monsoon, it will be windy with swells and slightly cooler over the coast of Guangdong in the next couple of days. With Fung-wong departing, the weather will improve gradually over the region in the latter part of this week. A replenishment of the northeast monsoon is expected to reach the coast of southern China early next week. Temperatures will fall and the weather will be dry over the region.","weatherForecast":[{"forecastDate":"20251110","week":"Monday","forecastWind":"North force 4 to 5, force 6 offshore and on high ground later.","forecastWeather":"Cloudy periods in the morning and at night. Mainly fine and dry during the day.
